CatDescriptText: William Bowe, postal worker, Brushton, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 19, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of teachers paddling children?" Answer reads: "Yes, but it depends on the circumstances.  No teacher should be permitted to do the paddling.  Rather, it should be a job for the principal or the vice principal."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Double exposure: Portrait of man wearing striped cap and dark overcoat, standing in front of lighting store; Portrait of William Bowe wearing fedora, eyeglasses, and striped tie, standing in front of lighting store
